title: Can we have Juggernaut AND Cinderhulk?
body:
One of the biggest problems I noticed in the past is that Juggernaut really mostly helps Fighters more than it helps actual Tanks, due to how Tenacity tends to work. Now with Cinderhulk rolling around, tanks are going to be getting the help they need, but now Fighters are getting the (slightly) short end of the stick in the lack of another Tenacity item for them to access.

Can we keep Cinderhulk *and* Juggernaut? Both parties (Jungle Tanks and Jungle Fighters) would be happy, methinks.

replies.body: Fighters don't need help. Your argument is sound, other than that. If they needed that item, I would tend to agree with you, but isn't warrior better anyway?

Depends.

For example, Tank-like Fighters (Volibear comes to mind) *really* like what Juggernaut offers over what Warrior tends to enable them.

Fair. But on voli, I don't see why losing the item is bad. On the contrary, I think Cinderhulk is designed to help champions like Voli. I mean, it's going to make his health scaling EVEN BETTER. Is that not the madness that was needed to bring him back into the meta? I think that's way better than some tenacity that he can easily pick up on boots.

Again, open to being corrected.
Ahh, I was specifically comparing Warrior to Juggernaut with the Volibear example. Cinderhulk vs Juggernaut for Volibear specifically would probably be more of a debated thing.

Ok. Not to beat a dead horse then, but who do you think Jugg is better for than Cinderhulk? To me, that's the issue of your post. I don't see why we would want both of those.

For any given champ, I would think Warrior or Cinderhulk was better than Juggernaut. In other words, there's no reason to keep it, as you suggest.

Right now, I only see Juggernaut on people who would rather have Cinderhulk.

This is a problem with Elise IMO not the itemisation. The item that Elise should logicically want to build as an AP jungler is {{item:3708}} but her ratios are so undertuned she can't.

Oh I definitely agree. Just saying that she's at least one jungler who'd rather have Juggernaut. 

Of course the fact that her ideal item is one that she doesn't scale with and thats primary attraction is making her tanky without actually expecting her to tank damage to be worthwhile probably says a lot about just how terrible she is right now.

I'm of a camp that thinks Elise could use the Nidalee treatment, i.e. making her two forms accomplish more specific things so she's more "I have a time when I want to be in each of these forms" and less "I have 6 abilities." As the game currently stands, her and Jayce are both reasonably difficult to keep balanced.
Elise is so over nerfed right now anyway that the item she gets is almost unimportant. She needs buffs and if she got them she would probably get magus.

In my personal experience, there are the Raid Boss champions. Think Trundle, Jax, Xin Zhao, all the champions who want a combination of Tenacity, 40% CDR, and a crapton of Tankiness to complement TF+BotRK and the Raid Bosses' already built in hyper scaling steroids. Juggernaut contributes much more to these wants than Cinderhulk does, and also allows space for Ninja Tabi, which is one of the better items for maximizing a Raid Bosses' dueling potential. Yeah, I guess you can argue a (for example) Xin Zhao who gets fed early can afford to go more damage based and buy Warrior, but getting fed early is not a feat achievable in every single game.
What do you mean by "raid boss" champs

> [{quoted}](name=TehNACHO,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E4AZIz9G,comment-id=000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-06T17:13:43.181+0000)
>
> Think Trundle, Jax, Xin Zhao,

For some quick examples. 

Raid Bosses are Auto Attack/DPS based champs, generally melee, with gigantic built in steroids either or both offensive and defensive in nature. They tend to have a powerful auto attack reset on low cool down, which when combined with a TF and 40% CDR, allows their DPS to scale incredibly hard without too much slot investment. Their abilities also tend to have terrible scaling despite each individual activation being powerful, for example there isn't any way to augment Trundle's Frozen Domain through raw stats, once again reinforcing 40% CDR. 

Standard Raid Bosses tend to build these items:
{{item:3153}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3111}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3110}}, supplemented by a 6th item with 10% CDR or having 10% CDR in their runes and masteries.
So, pretty much champions you have to 1v2/1v3 to take down?
One way of thinking about it.

>Think Trundle, Jax, Xin Zhao, all the champions who want a combination of Tenacity, 40% CDR, and a crapton of Tankiness to complement TF+BotRK and the Raid Bosses' already built in hyper scaling steroids. 

Every champ you listed gets good mileage out of warrior. They can all also use devourer. I'd never really consider Juggernaut on Xin or Jax, they both scale too well with warrior/devour respectively.

>Raid Bosses

I think you're misusing this term. A raid boss is an unkillable tanky bruiser who can pump out decent damage even without necessarily building for damage. I'd consider champs like Cho'gath and Shyvana to be raid bosses, certainly not a Xin or Jax, Trundle maybe. If you build straight defence on Jax/Xin you fall of super hard and just do nothing.

I guess they could put tenacity on Warrior... Yes I know it's a horrible, terrible abomination of an idea, but someone had to say it.
Burn the witch!

Tenacity shouldn't be easy to obtain (in terms of how many items offer it)

It's an incredibly powerful stat and having it pretty much only on boots makes itemizing for it enough of a sacrifice that you kinda have to think about it
Though from the looks of it... tenacity will become less and less useful (Recently riot seems to have been favoring knock ups/knock backs and such which tenacity has no effect on)

Riot has said that knock ups will be reduced by tenacity soon.

Expect changes in future patches. 

https://twitter.com/RiotMorello/status/573361985179545600

That is interesting and good to hear
Though even with that change knock ups will still be better then stuns
Because currently QSS and cleanse don't work on them (you are still airborn but I think you might then be able to flash as it would remove the mini stun as you are knocked up)
And Knock ups also stop all mid air movement abilities 
(like if Tristana is hit by a knock up as she is jumping or Jarvan E + Q or Shyvana ult... the most common scenario I think it probably Thresh knocking Leona out of her E dash and this only works because it is a knock back or knock up)

Though I think the fact that knock ups stop movement is a good thing.. if you are able to hit a champion mid dash/jump you should be able to stop them though I feel a bit sad for Shyvana if there was even more things that could mess with her ult which she relies on (blinks are obviously impossible to stop as they are instant) 

And hopefully they will eventually make it so that QSS and Cleanse works on knock ups...
Like seriously QSS works on suppression (which is only ults) but not on knock ups..

Any of the mentioned champions who would still need Juggernaut either work better with cinder, or should be getting warrior then a randiuns.

Juggernaut is somewhat useless at this point.
Raid Bosses tend to undermine this rule. They want slot efficient Tenacity and CDR above all else, which Juggernaut has an Cinderhulk lacks.

I dunno, the other people in this thread are starting to convince me. There's no harm done to the game for leaving it in, frankly. That's why it isn't stupid to do so. If some Jax/Elise/Trundle builds can use it, fine. It isn't a toxic item.

Idk I like to build Devourer on Raid Bosses. That extra burst damage is extremely nice especially when you are AS based. Generally Tenacity doesn't do much when your goal is to dive the enemy team blow someone up and disrupt the team. If you kill someone and put a decent amount of damage on their team combined with how much knock ups there are now. It just isn't worth buying tenacity, I would rather have the scaling damage.

More of a preference thing at this point then. Most knock ups can be dodged, and (at least when my ping isn't trying to impress me with how high it can go) I usually do my part not to walk right into a given champion's knock ups. More instantaneous stuns on the other hand...

Besides that, most Raid Bosses already have the built in damage to hurt a hell of a lot even without TF and BotRK, so overloading at that point is just slot inefficient in my mind.

I'll miss juggernaut on my current Aatrox build, since he doesn't need anymore help with clearing camps, but that being said cinderhulk definitely won't be bad instead and other then my little preference I cannot think of a single champion who would benefit more from juggernaut over cinderhulk.

Yeah you lose somethings like the tenacity and a small amount of health, but you get so much more form cinderhulk instead that even if both were in the game NO ONE would ever bother to waste their gold on juggernaut if they could get cinderhulk.

Ohh no we already have a meta that revolves around bruisers, they don't need much more right now. It actually might be juggernaut enchantment that makes them so strong right now and I might be totally wrong but stuff like Xin Zhao, Udyr, JARVAN, LEE SIN, VI(do you see what I mean here) shouldn't get tankiness, tenacity, and CDR all smashed into their jungle item. IMO the change to Cinderhulk is a power shift over to Tank junglers, which is awesome.
The current meta revolves around assassins. Get your shit together man.

I think EVERY assassin in the game or at least every popular assassin last season got horrribly gutted or at least received SOME form of nerf lol minus LB and Yasuo(technically not an assassin)
There's not too many of them that are still playable.

I'm of the mind that Cinderhulk on its own is strictly worse than Juggernaut. Less HP, no tenacity, no CDR. Same cost. As a jungler, I don't treally want to buy  second health item just to make Cinderhulk "not quite so bad". I can deal without the Tenacity by getting boots. Or I can get the CDR with a different set of boots. But not both.

Fortunately, CDR is a lot easier to come by. So I'll likely get the {{item:3111}} and my CDR elsewhere. But its a straight up nerf to tanky junglers right when they don't need it.
